thread.section_title: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
thread.title: Boeing demonstrates lightest metal ever

title: Boeing demonstrates lightest metal ever
text:
World's lightest material developed November 17, 2011 
A team of researchers from UC Irvine, HRL Laboratories and the California Institute of Technology have developed the world's lightest material  with a density of 0.9 mg / cc  about 100 times lighter than Styrofoam. ... HRL's breakthrough development of ultralight microlattice materials recognized October 5, 2012 
Researchers from HRL Laboratories are among the honorees of Popular Mechanics' 2012 Breakthrough Awards for their development of ultralight microlattice materials. Lightweight membrane can significantly reduce in-flight aircraft noise April 27, 2015
